1.title: Aberdeen
1.plot: James and Martin return home to their very own Brew Dog Brewery in Aberdeen, Scotland to revive the ghost of a dead Scottish beer.

2.title: Brooklyn
2.plot: James and Martin head to Brooklyn, the craft beer epicenter of the East Coast, and team up with entrepreneurial home brewers Stephen Valand and Erica Shea of the Brooklyn Brew Shop as well as modernist chef Wylie Dufresne to create the ultimate Big Apple Beer.

3.title: Louisville
3.plot: A night of drinking in Louisville with Sean Patton and Jay Larson of "Best Bars in America" inspires James and Martin to brew a beer that tastes like the signature drink of the Kentucky Derby, a mint julep. Teaming up with Against the Grain Brewery, the guys head to Buffalo Trace Distillery and build a Ferris wheel of bourbon barrels to infuse their beer with some of the finest bourbons on the planet.

4.title: Berlin
4.plot: James and Martin are in Germany, where they're teaming up with old friend Greg Koch, who is poised to open Stone Berlin, the first ever American craft brewery to land in Europe. The three craft beer pioneers join together again to celebrate one of the world's most renown beer cultures while rocking the establishment by brewing a beer that flies in the face of one of the country's most archaic laws.

5.title: Vancouver, BC
5.plot: James and Martin head to Vancouver, BC to craft the perfect pre's-ski beer, a piping hot-chocolate beer brewed in Whistler. Partnering with Vancouver's Main Street Brewing Company, the guys take advantage of Whistler's many high-adrenaline activities, and take their brew on the ultimate winter sports adventure.

6.title: Grand Rapids, MI
6.plot: James and Martin head to Grand Rapids, Michigan and take advantage of the icy temperatures to brew a potent, ice-concentrated Eisbock with Founders Brewing Company. And what better place to brew an Eisbock than 15 feet under a frozen lake.

7.title: Brussels
7.plot: James and Martin split up to discover the best of Belgium's craft beer scene while helping to create some of the world's most distinctive beers.

8.title: Miami
8.plot: The heat is on in Miami, where James and Martin pay tribute to the city's infamous rum running history and brew a rum barrel aged beer while traversing the waterways outside of Miami Harbor.

9.title: Nashville
9.plot: James and Martin head to Music City to brew a beer inspired by Nashville's legendary music scene. The guys team up with Tennessee Brew Works and use music to power their brew system.

10.title: Baja
10.plot: James and Martin head south of the border to experience the adventurous side of the Baja Peninsula. In the spirit of the Baja 1000, the wildest, most outrageous off-road race on the planet, the guys brew an equally outrageous beer, using sea urchin and peyote skins and serving it up Michelada style.

1.title: San Diego
1.plot: James and Martin set out to make a quintessential Southern California brew by using ingredients they harvest themselves, including kelp and the world's hottest chili -- brewed while traveling 70mph on a train up the Pacific coast.

2.title: San Francisco
2.plot: The Brew Dogs get "foggy" in San Fran by making the world's first vaporized beer. You don't drink this beer, you inhale it.

3.title: Philadelphia
3.plot: James and Martin make The Most American Beer Ever Brewed. It's brewed on a float during a Fourth of July parade -- and the final ingredient is added as fireworks light up the Philadelphia sky.

4.title: Seattle
4.plot: James and Martin brew the world's most-caffeinated beer -- a big, bold, chocolate-coffee imperial stout -- on the top deck of the Bainbridge Island Ferry.

5.title: Denver
5.plot: In the mountains of Colorado, James and Martin team up with Dale of Dale's Pale Ale to invent a wild west beer.

6.title: Portland
6.plot: Portland, Oregon, has a unique personality that calls for a unique beer. That's no easy task in a town that's home to 60 craft breweries and world-renown hops. So what do you say we cut out the hops entirely? James Watt and Martin Dickie enlist the help of Ben Kehs from Deschutes Brewery and urban forager Becky Lerner to brew a Berliner Weiss like no other. Our mad scientists combine locally foraged scotch broom, yarrow and raspberries for a sweet and tart concoction brewed on the Willamette River. That's right--they cast off on a day-long voyage aboard a custom-built...

7.title: Boston
7.plot: In the season finale, Martin and James brew a Boston Clambake beer infused with lobsters and clams. They take their beer on the high seas on a tall ship sailing through Boston Harbor along with Sam Adams' proprietor and legendary craft beer entrepreneur Jim Koch.

1.title: Durham, North Carolina
1.plot: In the season premiere, James and Martin are in Durham, North Carolina, on a quest to brew a beer with the most calories ever. But first, the two take a spin class where they dream up a concept for brewing while biking. Can they engineer the first pedal-powered trolley pub? Then, Martin and James head to Waterfall Farms to gather their own maple syrup, pair it with delicious local bacon, and toss it into their invention. See fitness meet gluttony in one of the coolest contraptions the show has seen!

2.title: Las Vegas, Nevada
2.plot: James and Martin hit Chicago, Illinois, to make the greenest beer ever for St. Patrick's Day. But how will they make a draft that looks, tastes, and is made as green as possible? The boys get in the spirit by joining a traditional Irish hooley and taking in some local color, including a beer and bacon tasting. But the duo wants a truly Chicago beer--and it wouldn't be a Windy City draft without a wind-powered brewery! See whether their experiment can be a St. Paddy's hit, or a green disaster!

3.title: Chicago, Illinois
3.plot: James and Martin are hitting The Strip! They've traveled to the city renowned for its excess to brew the most expensive beer in the world. On the ingredient list are Tanzanian cocoa nibs, Tahitian vanilla bean, a thousand dollar truffle and 24 karat gold. Can they pull it off and find a bottle befitting such a kingly beverage or will their Golden Stout end up just being an expensive mistake? Plus, the "Brew Dogs" face off in a beer pairing competition, experiment with beer shampoo and reveal the top 5 craft beer bars in Sin City!

4.title: Delaware
4.plot: Martin and James are challenging their own record to brew the fastest beer in the world! They enlist the help of Dogfish Head Brewery founder Sam Calagione to be their pit man as they prepare their creation at breakneck speeds on the Dover International Speedway. Can they break 72 miles per hour in their custom-built mobile brewery? Plus, the "Brew Dogs" harvest their own local honey, invent a beer-inspired caramel corn called "hopcorn," and convert some craft beer virgins!

5.title: Durango, CO
5.plot: It's a glass from the past! Martin and James travel back in time to brew an "ancient modern ale" using the techniques and tools that natives would've had in the area 1,000 years ago. To keep it authentic, they'll grind their own malted corn, harvest pine nuts from towering treetops, and make custom clay pots to hold their precious concoction. With the help of Ska Brewing president Dave Thibodeau, can the Brew Dogs make the ghosts of Mesa Verde National Park proud?

6.title: Northern California
6.plot: In an RV in Northern California, James and Martin make impromptu craft pairings with campfire food and create the ultimate collaboration beer with the help of a local professor, the "Pope of Foam."

7.title: Hawaii
7.plot: Aloha! James and Martin capture the sweet island life of Hawaiian in a brew boiled using super-heated lava rocks. With the help of Maui Brewing Company founder Garrett Merrero, the duo set off to harvest local coconut and sugar cane for a sweet Imperial golden ale that's fit for a luau. See if their caramelized concoction gains the approval of Maui's beer lovers or gets them sent packing.

8.title: Alaska
8.plot: James and Martin visit remote Juneau, Alaska, and then travel deeper into the wilderness to brew the ultimate Alaskan survival beer. Using spare parts from a pontoon plane as a makeshift brewing kit, they set off with the help of Steve from Alaskan Brewing Co. to forage local ingredients and collect genuine glacier ice. But without any native hops, can the Brew Dogs find a tasty substitute out in the middle of nowhere? Time to get resourceful!

9.title: New Orleans
9.plot: The boys arrive in the Crescent City with a plan to capture its revival spirit by bringing back an extinct beer style using local ingredients. That means visiting Warner Farms to pick fresh mayhaws from the orchard, having Roses of Jericho blessed by a voodoo priestess, and devising a four-water filtration system so that they can pump genuine Louisiana swamp water into their kettles. See if their Peeterman style NOLA brew breathes new life into an old classic or is declared dead on arrival.

10.title: Los Angeles
10.plot: James and Martin head to L.A., the home-brewing capital of America to face off head-to-head to make the ultimate SoCal beer. Using quintessential California ingredients citrus and sage, the boys set off with their home-brewing partners to brew some wild concoctions. But everyone is thrown for a loop when a secret ingredient is added to the mix: avocado! Can they handle the curveball and seize the chance to showcase their beer at the famous Golden Road Brewery on the line?

-1.title: Michigan
-1.plot: James and Martin head to Grand Rapids, Michigan and take advantage of the icy, sub-zero temperatures to brew a potent, ice-concentrated Eisbock with craft beer giants Founders Brewing Company. And what better place to brew an Eisbock than 15 feet under a frozen lake.

imdb.title: Brew Dogs
plot: Two Scottish brewers go around the world to accomplish various beer brewing challenges.
synopsis: Craft beer as reality TV is an idea aligned with the explosion of interest in craft beer and the increasing number of breweries nationwide. Its been tried before most notably by Discovery Channel with Brew Masters, the 2010 show in cooperation with Dogfish Head Brewing. It was canceled after one season, thanks to both low ratings and reported pressure from a large beer company who threatened to pull advertising from Discovery.So its with interest that we viewed the premiere of Esquire Networks new Brew Dogs. In the three years since 2010, craft beer has gone mainstream-ish. The shows stars, Scotsmen James Watt and Martin Dickie, bring an evangelists sensibility to their celebration of craft beerpart of their hope is to convert craft beer virgins.Each episodes premise is seemingly simple: Visit a town with a thriving craft beer scene, Anthony Bourdain-style and brew a crazy beer celebrating that scene. What makes the show work are the charming antics of Watt and Dickie, whose Scottish brewery BrewDog is known for a rather extreme approach to beer and an in-your-face punk ethos. The show intersperses educational elements with spontaneous attempts by the brewdogs to convert unsuspecting targets into craft beer loversyou see them approaching middle-aged ladies, residents of a senior citizens home and random folks in a train station.
